page.title: 14The High Street,Chislehurst
page.content: People's attitudes in Chislehurst are probably typical of the area.They are very anxious to keep the character of the High St., which still has village features. The oldest stretch, near the pond, was wide enough to turn a cart. Trees and parking spaces now narrow it. The Church at one end and pond and common the other give it a village look. This impression is lost on weekdays because of the pressure of traffic, particularly between 8 and 9.30am and 5 and 6.30pm. Shoppers felt that the High St.was no longer a place to browse and linger as it has the feel of a through road. They also felt that the building of a supermarket has caused traffic chaos and caused businesses to close down.People worry that the High St.may be losing its individuality.
